revised_title: Middle Atmosphere Programme: Advances in Understanding the Stratosphere
tldr: The Middle Atmosphere Programme (MAP) was an international cooperative study of the atmospheric region from 10 to 100 km above Earth's surface. This paper outlines the main achievements of the 17 projects conducted during the MAP period and compares the understanding of the middle atmosphere in 1986 to that in 1976. Key findings include the importance of the polar vortex as a material entity, the role of small-scale motions in the stratospheric circulation, and the potential impact of these motions on stratospheric chemistry.
